column1: In hydrology, [1] is the volumetric flow rate of water that is transported through a given cross-sectional area.

The [1] [1] [1] (Portuguese: [2] [2] [2]) is the confluence between the dark ([3]) Rio Negro and the pale sandy-colored ([4]) Amazon River, referred to as the Solimões River in Brazil upriver of this confluence. It is one of the main tourist attractions of [5], Brazil.
